recipes.title: Berry Chia Pudding
recipes.description: This healthy protein-packed and fresh fruit chia pudding is so good it could be used as a light dessert, or delicious breakfast. Like overnight oats, chia can soak overnight, or you can cook it over a stove top.
recipes.additional_info: You can read more about the super benefits of chia seeds in our blog. You can find them in the health aisle of our stores at a great price.
recipes.directions: Combine chia seeds, almond milk, coconut milk, and honey in a bowl. Stir well and refrigerate overnight or cook over medium heat for 10 minutes. Top with strawberries, blueberries, pistachio nuts, and edible flowers before serving.

recipes.title: Avocado Toast
recipes.description: A simple, quick, and healthy avocado toast that is perfect for a light breakfast or a snack. Packed with healthy fats and nutrients.
recipes.additional_info: For a variation, you can add toppings like poached eggs, tomatoes, or seeds to enhance flavor and nutrition.
recipes.directions: Toast the whole-grain bread to your desired crispness. Spread the mashed avocado on the toast. Drizzle olive oil on top, then season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Lentil Soup
recipes.description: A hearty and nutritious lentil soup that is perfect for a comforting meal. Loaded with vegetables and protein-rich lentils, it's both filling and healthy.
recipes.additional_info: This soup can be frozen and stored for up to a month, making it ideal for meal prep.
recipes.directions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onion, carrots, celery, and garlic. Cook until vegetables are softened. Add lentils, cumin, paprika, vegetable broth, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes until lentils are tender. Garnish with parsley before serving.

recipes.title: Vegan Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: A rich, moist, and decadent vegan chocolate cake that is perfect for any occasion. You won't believe it's dairy-free and egg-free!
recipes.additional_info: This cake is perfect for those following a plant-based diet or those with dairy allergies. It can be topped with vegan frosting or fresh fruit.
recipes.directions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour an 8-inch cake pan. In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Add the almond milk, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, and apple cider vinegar. Mix until smooth. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and bake for 30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool before serving.
